title: How to Remove a Device from the HP Smart App

steps.title: Open the HP Smart app on your computer.
steps.content: Open the HP Smart app on your computer. HP Smart's app should be in your Start menu's list of apps, but you can also find it by typing hp smart into the Windows search bar or your Mac's Launchpad. HP Smart has a blue icon with a printer and tablet. Sometimes it takes several minutes to load all data for all HP devices in HP Smart. You can also remove devices from the HP Smart app on your Android, iPhone, or iPad. Just download the app from the Play Store for Android or the App Store for iOS, launch the app, and sign in. steps.title: Select the device you want to remove.
steps.content: Select the device you want to remove. Use the navigational arrow icons to scroll through linked HP printers and devices, then double-click the one you want to remove. This will take you to the Printer Settings page. If you're using the mobile HP Smart app, tap your printer, then skip to step 3 . If you are not taken to the Printer Settings page, click the blue Printer Settings tile at the bottom of the window.

steps.title: Click Hide Printer.
steps.content: Click Hide Printer . You'll see this under "Manage" in the left panel on a computer, and at the bottom of the menu on a phone or tablet. Don't worryâ€”even though it says "Hide," this will still permanently remove your device from HP Smart.

steps.title: Click Hide Printer to confirm.
steps.content: Click Hide Printer to confirm. You'll see this button just below "Select Hide This Printer to remove it from the HP Smart App."

steps.title: Follow the on-screen instructions to complete removal.
steps.content: Follow the on-screen instructions to complete removal. The app will prompt you to confirm again before removing the device from the app. Once the printer is removed, it will no longer appear in the device list. If you cannot remove your printer using this method, jump to Using HPSmart.com .

steps.title: Log in to HP Smart on the web.
steps.content: Log in to HP Smart on the web. Even if you use the HP Smart desktop app on your PC, you can use the web-based version of HP Smart to remove devices. The PC app can be glitchy and not allow you to remove printers, so this method should be helpful even if you've already tried using the app. Go to https://www.hpsmart.com and click Sign In at the top-right corner to log in now. If you don't know your login information, you can click Forgot your name? to locate it and, if necessary, reset your password.

steps.title: Click the three-line menu and select Printers.
steps.content: Click the three-line menu and select Printers . You'll see the menu in the upper-left corner of the dashboard when you sign in. This lists all printing devices connected to your HP Smart account.

steps.title: Click Printer Options beneath your printer.
steps.content: Click Printer Options beneath your printer. A few options will appear. If you don't see this option, click the name of the device you want to remove first.

steps.title: Click Remove Printer.
steps.content: Click Remove Printer . A confirmation message will appear.

steps.title: Click Remove and follow the on-screen instructions.
steps.content: Click Remove and follow the on-screen instructions. Once you've removed a device from HP Smart on the web, it will no longer appear in the HP Smart app on your other devices. You may need to log out and back in to the HP Smart app on your computer, phone, or tablet to see the changes.

steps.title: Make sure you are signed in to the HP Smart app.
steps.content: Make sure you are signed in to the HP Smart app. Even if your printer does appear in HP Smart, you may have been logged out of the app. If you don't see your initials at the upper-left corner of the HP Smart app, you're not logged in. Click the outline of a person in a circle, then click Sign in to log into your HP account.

steps.title: Add another device to HP Smart.
steps.content: Add another device to HP Smart. If you can't remove your device from HP Smart, your account may require at least one HP+ compatible printing device to be connected to your account. Try adding another printer to HP Smart before removing a device.

steps.title: Connect the printer to the internet.
steps.content: Connect the printer to the internet. If it's been a long time since your HP Smart-compatible printer was last connected to Wi-Fi, the HP Smart app may not be able to remove it until you've connected again at least once.

steps.title: Remove the device using HP Smart on the web instead of the app.
steps.content: Remove the device using HP Smart on the web instead of the app. Sometimes the app acts a little funny about removing devices. Log in to https://www.hpsmart.com in your web browser and remove the printer that way.
